text: Hans Jacob Hansen (August 10, 1855 – June 26, 1936) was a Danish zoologist, known for his contributions to carcinology (the study of crustacea). He was born in Bellinge and died in Gentofte. He participated on the first year of the Ingolf expedition to Iceland and Greenland in 1895. ==References== *Biographical Etymology of Marine Organism Names - H. ==Literature== * Category:1855 births Category:1936 deaths Category:Danish zoologists Category:Danish carcinologists
title: Hans Jacob Hansen
